name: export
title: Pathling Export Operation
description: This operation allows data to be exported from the Pathling server in NDJSON format. The operation follows the FHIR Bulk Data Access specification for system-level export, supporting asynchronous export of FHIR resources.

parameter.name: _outputFormat
parameter.documentation: The format for the requested export files. Pathling supports Newline Delimited JSON format only. Accepted values are 'application/fhir+ndjson', 'application/ndjson', and 'ndjson'. Defaults to 'application/fhir+ndjson' if not specified.

parameter.name: _since
parameter.documentation: Resources will be included in the response if their state has changed after the supplied time (i.e., if Resource.meta.lastUpdated is later than the supplied _since time).

parameter.name: _until
parameter.documentation: Resources will be included in the response if their state has changed before the supplied time (i.e., if Resource.meta.lastUpdated is earlier than the supplied _until time).

parameter.name: _type
parameter.documentation: A comma-delimited list of FHIR resource types. Only resources of the specified types will be included in the export. If this parameter is omitted, all supported resource types will be exported, subject to authorisation constraints. If an unsupported or invalid resource type is specified, the server will return an error unless the 'Prefer: handling=lenient' header is included, in which case the unsupported type will be ignored.

parameter.name: _elements
parameter.documentation: A comma-delimited list of FHIR elements to include in the exported resources. Elements must be specified as either '[resource type].[element name]' (e.g., 'Patient.name') to apply to a specific resource type, or '[element name]' (e.g., 'id') to apply to all resource types. Only top-level elements are supported. Mandatory elements will always be included regardless of this parameter. Resources will be marked with the SUBSETTED tag when this parameter is used.
